intro: Draba incana var. sylvatica, commonly known as the alpine bellflower, is a flowering plant native to mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, cruciform flowers and pungent odor. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils and full sunlight. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Draba incana var. sylvatica is known for its hardy nature and ability to survive in harsh, cold climates.
